website_summaries.verdict: While some users are skeptical of its 60-mile range, this directional antenna has good reception even in areas w/obstacles (hills, trees).
pros: Good reception, even in hilly areas
Works well with or without a preamplifier
Strong signal, even when a splitter is used
cons: Some feel it doesn’t pick up UHF stations clearly enough
Directional antenna means some users must buy a 2nd antenna to aim at towers in the opposite direction

website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for an outdoors, this antenna can also be mounted in the attic and provides good channel reception with or without line of sight.
cons: An amplifier may be required to reach the manufacturer's stated range

customer_reviews.title: ... 40 miles which is about what i am getting good picture works well but not the range that amazon ...
customer_reviews.text: Says 70 Mile range all over amazons website but if you go to RCA website and put in this model it says 40 miles which is about what i am getting good picture works well but not the range that amazon says.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a flat indoor antenna and can receive 6 over the air channels with it. I wanted to put an outdoor antenna up, in the hopes of getting more channels and stronger signals, so I bought this RCA Outdoor Yagi. Before putting the RCA antenna up outside, I replaced the indoor antenna with the yagi, and put it at the exact same location I have the indoor antenna. I got zero channels with it. Hard to believe, but this thing did absolutely nothing. My TV doesn't even acknowledge it is there. Not a good product, so back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Shaggy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your $$$!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this antenna. I would give it 0 stars if I could. Very flimsy. Came with bent parts. It only pulls NBC and Fox and no reception for ABC, CBS etc. and we’re only 4 miles from the towers (with a clear shot). I bought this antenna hoping it would do better than the window unit I had but that’s not the case. Don’t waste your money. I would return it if I could, but I already have it up on the roof. Will now have to spend more money searching for a better solution.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: No better than a flat indoor antenna.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item when I was no longer happy with my flat indoor antenna. Assembled it, climbed onto the roof, mounted it, then rushed downstairs to get my TV's to search for new channels. And I didn't get ONE new channel. The channels that didn't work before still didn't work. Tried it again and few days later. No more channels. Brought it down, packed it up, now it's in the basement gathering dust. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: J. McG

customer_reviews.title: I installed this antenna and pointed it just between Seattle and the location where channel 13 transmits from and Every channel comes in great. Now I can watch the Seahawks again
customer_reviews.text: I live approx 40 miles from most of the major tv stations in the Seattle area. With my older antenna which was much smaller I was able to receive all of the tv stations EXCEPT channel 13 FOX which is located approx 55 miles from me and located further West of my location. I installed this antenna and pointed it just between Seattle and the location where channel 13 transmits from and Every channel comes in great. Now I can watch the Seahawks again. This antenna is very directional so 2 inches one way or the other is the difference between a picture and nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Giant sharp object that belongs in the trash
customer_reviews.text: Wireless TV signal is dead. I spent a two days & roughly $400 on shielded new cables, this antenna, a booster, amplifier etc... I live outside Boston by 30 miles. I explored every avenue possible. I installed on a pole in the exact location, with every amenity you can think of you can purchase, with the help of my electrician neighbor to verify I wasn’t crazy... We both came to a conclusion... Wireless Digital Tv is dead... I got two channels in Spanish... lol The worst part is I was so defeated after all of this mess I just pitched it all... not even worth the return of this flimsy waste of money. Amazon... You got me again this time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Truthful Fishing Tale

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me. I did not receive ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me. I did not receive any local channels. I live in the IE, Ca. The nearest towers are 50 miles away. Received other unwanted channels, but not the local channel to watch my evening news as I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made. Wire broke off
customer_reviews.text: I unboxed this item and put it together with no problems. The wires that connect to the antenna seemed very cheaply made and wouldn't ya know, after I installed it, it picked up channels for an hour and then tv went blank. I looked at the antenna and the wire broke off. I am a a very technical person so I installed two new connectors and tried to reinstall and once again, the piece broke off. The wires that come out of the splitter are way too thin. They simply break off. I was very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gruver

customer_reviews.title: Weak link ruins this great antenna
customer_reviews.text: Had this on the roof for 4 yrs, suddenly a loss of signal. Ladder up to roof, (age 65 now) inspect antenna, come to find out the OLD style flat lead connection to the antenna was broken one one wire. It is a short pigtail converter from coax to flat lead. True I can get another for around 3 to 5 bucks. However it's just not worth the climb on the roof anymore, for a minor item which shouldn't even extis on modern antenna's anymore. I replaced the whole antenna with a clearview 4 , yes more expensive... but no weak link. I get the same channels as before as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: My experience says buy this thing NOW!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, messed around with a few of the paper-thin indoor omni-directional antennas, a few with amplifiers a few without and their performance some days was acceptable but some days was terrible. Finally decided it was time to invest a little more money and a little more effort to consistently get great reception. There's simply no comparison between this and the indoor models. Mounted in the attic above the garage, pointed it in the general direction of the city that is 35 miles north of me and couldn't be more happy.
customer_reviews.author: wander_indiana

customer_reviews.title: Looks simple, but works great
customer_reviews.text: I finally cut off my DirecTV, took down the dish and mounted this antenna. I am 30+ miles away from all the Las Vegas station transmitters (NW side of town). This antenna looks simple, but works great from my house. I mounted it on the old DirecTV pole. I did have an indoor antenna with a booster and only received half the stations I receive now, many with less clarity. Dump the dish, especially if you mostly need local stations. In Las Vegas, channel 5 (FOX) was the toughest to receive. Now comes in great (picture) for football season.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry, Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Can find others antennas that get more channels
customer_reviews.text: I was first impressed by the number of reviews on Amazon for this RCA antenna. It being the most popular , however, I did a test with another roof top antenna I bought at Best Buys and the Best Buys antenna got like 30 channels more plus I didnt like the fact that the amplifier hook up was up near where the antenna was. The best buys antenna came already with an amplifier. This one you have to buy your ownn seperately. The extra channels though were mostly foreign and home shopping channels.
customer_reviews.author: fishorsechess

product_meta.title: TV Antenna - RCA Outdoor Yagi Satellite HD Antenna with Over 70 Mile Range - Attic or Roof Mount TV Antenna, Long Range Digital OTA Antenna for Clear Reception, 4K 1080P
product_meta.description: Get superior reception without the whole neighborhood noticing. This compact outdoor antenna is designed to maximize signal reception and integrate seamlessly into any home environment, indoors or out. Receive all available local HD digital broadcasts channels for free, including digital formats via UHF and VHF frequencies.
feature_bullets: Enjoy top-rated HDTV network programming on channels like CBS, NBC, FOX, ABC and more; Your favorite shows for free (no more cable bills) with no monthly fee or subscription; Great complement to streaming players and dependable backup source when storms knock out cable or satellite
Receives TV broadcasts including 4K, 8K and 1080 HDTV for highest-quality picture and sound - both UHF and VHF stations – with up to 70+ mile range from the broadcast towers
Withstands tough outdoor conditions with durable construction and materials; Superior reception outdoors or even when mounted in the attic

Easy installation with pre-assembled design, easy-lock fold-out UHF reflector and snap-lock elements; Includes mast, locking mast clamp, mounting hardware and 75-ohm matching transformer (coax cable sold separately)
The free RCA Signal Finder app is your digital compass that guides you to the most high definition channels and aligns your antenna perfectly

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars7,823 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
